content.description: A fantastic small sector of bouldering that is dense in quality lines. The setting is grand, located near the Slocan River, this area offers many fine views, and the climbing is set amongst some big cedars that offer up a nice amount of shade. The rock here is made up of a very unique type of Gneiss, abound with tons of cool features and interesting pockets. Steep, powerful climbing is the main focus here but there are a few other cool problems/projects around as well, most of the climbing falls in the V2-V9 range. If awesome, aesthetic, steep bouldering is your thing; this place should be on your must-visit list!! There are also tons of quality post-climbing swimming holes, just take a walk down the rail-trail to one of the many small beaches! Have funâ€¦.
